docs.title: 欢迎使用 LeonBasic 编程语言
docs.text:
LeonBasic 是一种简单易用的解释型编程语言，专为初学者和快速原型开发设计。它提供了简洁明了的语法，同时支持基本的编程功能，如变量、函数、控制流、文件操作和网络功能等。

这是他的运行原理图：

graph LR

    Dev["开发者"]:::external

    subgraph "核心引擎"
        direction TB
        CLI["LeonBasic 命令行工具"]:::core
        Parser["解析器与抽象语法树"]:::core
        Evaluator["执行器 / 运行时"]:::core
        Builtins["内置库"]:::core
        PackageLoader["包/模块加载器"]:::core
    end

    TestRunner["测试工具集"]:::test

    subgraph "工具与集成"
        direction TB
        VSExt["VS Code 扩展"]:::tooling
        Docs["文档生成器"]:::tooling
        Trae["Trae 引擎"]:::tooling
    end

    Dev -->|"编写 .leon 代码"| CLI

docs.title: 主要特性
docs.text:
• 简洁的语法 - 易于学习和使用
  • 内置库支持 - 包含基础操作和网络功能
  • 灵活的变量系统 - 支持字符串、整数和浮点数
  • 完善的控制流 - 包括条件语句和循环结构
  • 文件操作 - 支持文件的读写和追加
  • 网络功能 - 支持 HTTP 请求和文件下载
  • 错误处理 - 提供异常捕获机制

docs.title: 快速开始
docs.text:
1. 查看快速入门指南
  2. 学习基本语法
  3. 探索控制流、文件操作等高级功能

docs.title: 文档导航
docs.text:
使用左侧导航栏浏览完整文档，包括：

  • 快速入门 - 安装和使用指南
  • 基本语法 - 变量、函数、转义字符和内置库
  • 时间处理库 - 时间相关操作函数
  • 模块系统 - require函数和模块导入
  • 控制流 - 条件语句和循环
  • 文件操作 - 读写文件
  • 网络功能 - HTTP 请求和下载
  • 错误处理 - 异常捕获
  • 用户交互 - 菜单和用户输入

docs.title: 1. 打印 "Hello world!"
docs.text:
首先引入基础库（Basic）： 

require("basic");
然后调用打印函数： 
basic.print(string:"Hello world!");
* 格式：basic.print(string: "内容"); * 参数：string 类型，内容为字符串

docs.title: (1) 利用变量输出 "hi!"
docs.text:
require("basic");
var(a) = string:"hi!";
basic.print(var(a));

docs.title: (2) 将 string 和 int 结合为变量 c 并打印
docs.text:
require("basic");
var(a) = string:"Number: ";
var(b) = int:2;
var(c) = var(a) + string:var(b);
basic.print(var(c));
* 输出结果：Number: 2

docs.title: (3) 变量类型
docs.text: 支持的类型包括： * string：字符串 * int：整数 * float：浮点数

docs.title: 4. 转义字符
docs.text: 在字符串中，可以使用转义字符来表示特殊字符：

docs.title: (1) 支持的转义字符
docs.text:
• \n：换行符
  • \t：制表符
  • \r：回车符
  • \"：双引号
  • \\：反斜杠
  • \+：加号（特殊转义，显示为+）

docs.title: (2) 转义字符示例
docs.text:
require("basic");

// 基本转义字符
basic.print(string:"第一行\n第二行");

// 转义双引号
basic.print(string:"他说：\"你好！\"");

// \+转义为+
basic.print(string:"5 \+ 3 = 8");

// 反斜杠转义
basic.print(string:"路径：C:\\\\folder\\\\file.txt");

docs.title: (3) 转义字符在字符串拼接中的使用
docs.text:
require("basic");
var(a) = string:"Hello ";
var(b) = string:"\+ World!";
basic.print(var(a) + var(b));  // 输出：Hello + World!

## 5. 自定义函数

### (1) 无参数函数
```leon
require("basic");
func(test()) = {
    basic.print("Hello world!");
};
test();  // 调用函数，输出 Hello world!

docs.title: (2) 有参数函数
docs.text:
require("basic");
func(add(self(first), self(second))) = {
    basic.print(int:self(first) + int:self(second));
};
add(int:1, int:2);  // 调用函数，输出 3

docs.title: (3) 参数访问语法
docs.text: 在函数体中，使用 self(param_name) 来访问参数值： * int:self(first) - 获取参数 first 的整数值 * string:self(second) - 获取参数 second 的字符串值 * float:self(param) - 获取参数 param 的浮点数值

docs.title: (1) basic 库
docs.text:
• print()：打印文字或其他内容
  • runoscommand()：运行系统命令
  • setrequirepath()：设定 require 库的位置（不影响内置库）
  • input()：请求用户输入
  • pause()：让用户按下任意键继续

docs.title: (2) request 库
docs.text:
• get()：抓取内容
  • download()：下载文件
  • check()：查看状态码
  • header()：查看头信息
  • footer()：查看尾信息

docs.title: (3) time 库
docs.text:
• timestamp()：获取当前时间戳（毫秒）
  • formatTime()：格式化时间戳为字符串
  • sleep()：程序暂停指定毫秒数
  • diffTime()：计算两个时间戳之间的差值（毫秒）
  • getDateTime()：获取当前日期和时间字符串

docs.title: 1. 条件语句（if-else）
docs.text:
require("basic");
var(a) = int:5;
if(a > 3) {
    basic.print("a 大于 3");
} else {
    basic.print("a 不大于 3");
}

docs.title: (1) for 循环
docs.text:
require("basic");
for(var(i) = int:0; i < 5; i = i + 1) {
    basic.print(string:"循环次数: " + string:i);
}

docs.title: (2) while 循环
docs.text:
require("basic");
var(j) = int:0;
while(j < 3) {
    basic.print(string:"while 循环: " + string:j);
    j = j + 1;
}

docs.title: 1. try-catch 异常捕获
docs.text:
require("basic");
try {
    var(a) = int:5 / int:0;
} catch(error) {
    basic.print(string:"发生错误: " + error);
}

docs.title: 1. 文件写入
docs.text:
require("basic");
var(file) = basic.open("test.txt", "write");
basic.write(file, "Hello, world!");
basic.close(file);

docs.title: 2. 文件读取
docs.text:
require("basic");
var(file) = basic.open("test.txt", "read");
var(content) = basic.read(file);
basic.print(content);
basic.close(file);

docs.title: 3. 文件追加
docs.text:
require("basic");
var(file) = basic.open("test.txt", "append");
basic.write(file, " 追加内容");
basic.close(file);

docs.title: 安装
docs.text:
确保您的系统已安装 Rust，然后克隆仓库并构建：

git clone [仓库地址]
cd LeonLang
cargo build --release

docs.title: 运行程序
docs.text: ./target/release/leonlang your_file.leon

docs.title: 示例程序
docs.text:
创建一个简单的 hello.leon 文件：

require("basic");
basic.print(string:"Hello from LeonBasic!");

运行它：

./target/release/leonlang hello.leon

docs.title: 注意事项
docs.text:
• LeonBasic 是一个解释型语言，所有代码都在运行时解析执行
  • 变量定义时必须指定类型
  • 字符串拼接使用 + 运算符
  • 函数调用时参数需要指定类型（除了已定义的变量引用）
  • 文件操作完成后请记得调用 close() 方法关闭文件
  • 网络请求可能需要处理超时和错误情况

docs.title: 1. require 函数
docs.text: LeonBasic 提供了 require() 函数用于导入内置库和自定义模块，实现代码的模块化和复用。

docs.title: (1) 导入内置库
docs.text:
// 导入基础库
require("basic");

// 导入网络请求库
require("request");

// 导入时间处理库
require("time");

docs.title: (2) 导入自定义模块
docs.text:
// 导入当前目录下的 utils.leon 模块
require("utils");

// 使用模块中的函数
var(result) = utils.add(int:5, int:3);
basic.print(string:"5 + 3 = " + string:var(result));

docs.title: 2. 模块查找路径
docs.text:
当使用 require(module_name) 时，系统会按以下顺序查找模块：

  1. 首先查找内置库（如 basic、request）
  2. 然后在当前脚本所在目录查找 module_name.leon 文件
  3. 如果未找到，会在当前目录下的 lib 子目录查找

docs.title: (1) 创建简单模块
docs.text:
创建一个名为 utils.leon 的文件：

// utils.leon

// 定义模块函数
func(add(a, b)) = {
    return a + b;
};

func(multiply(a, b)) = {
    return a * b;
};

func(greet(name)) = {
    return "Hello, " + name + "!";
};

docs.title: (2) 模块使用示例
docs.text:
// main.leon
require("basic");
require("utils");

// 使用 utils 模块中的函数
var(sum) = utils.add(int:5, int:3);
basic.print(string:"5 + 3 = " + string:var(sum));

var(product) = utils.multiply(int:7, int:4);
basic.print(string:"7 * 4 = " + string:var(product));

var(greeting) = utils.greet(string:"World");
basic.print(var(greeting));

docs.title: 4. 设置 require 路径
docs.text:
可以使用 basic.setrequirepath() 函数自定义模块查找路径：

require("basic");

// 设置自定义模块路径
basic.setrequirepath("D:\\Projects\\LeonBasic\\modules");

// 现在可以从自定义路径加载模块
require("custom_module");

docs.title: 5. 模块函数调用语法
docs.text:
使用导入的模块函数时，遵循以下语法：

// 模块名.函数名(参数...)
module_name.function_name(param1, param2, ...);

docs.title: 6. 模块加载注意事项
docs.text:
• 模块文件必须以 .leon 为扩展名
  • 一个模块可以被多次导入，但只会执行一次
  • 模块中的变量和函数对导入者可见
  • 模块之间可以相互导入，但要避免循环依赖

docs.title: 1. HTTP GET 请求
docs.text:
require("request");
var(response) = request.get("https://example.com");
basic.print(response);

docs.title: 2. 下载文件
docs.text:
require("request");
request.download("https://example.com/image.jpg", "local.jpg");

docs.title: 1. 介绍
docs.text: LeonBasic 提供了 time 内置库，用于处理时间相关的操作，包括获取时间戳、格式化时间、程序暂停等功能。

docs.title: 2. 导入方法
docs.text:
在使用 time 库之前，需要先导入：

require("time");

docs.title: (1) timestamp() - 获取当前时间戳
docs.text:
获取当前系统时间的毫秒时间戳。

参数：无 返回值：整数类型，表示从1970-01-01 00:00:00 UTC开始的毫秒数

示例： 

require("basic");
require("time");

// 获取当前时间戳
var(ts) = time.timestamp();
basic.print(string:"当前时间戳: " + string:var(ts));

docs.title: (2) formatTime(timestamp, format) - 格式化时间戳
docs.text:
将时间戳格式化为指定格式的字符串。

参数： - timestamp: 整数类型，时间戳 - format: 字符串类型，格式字符串

返回值：字符串类型，格式化后的时间字符串

格式说明： - yyyy: 四位数年份 - MM: 两位数月份 (01-12) - dd: 两位数日期 (01-31) - HH: 两位数小时 (00-23) - mm: 两位数分钟 (00-59) - ss: 两位数秒数 (00-59) - SSS: 三位数毫秒 (000-999)

示例： 

require("basic");
require("time");

// 获取当前时间戳
var(ts) = time.timestamp();

// 默认格式 (yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss)
var(default_format) = time.formatTime(var(ts), "");
basic.print(string:"默认格式: " + var(default_format));

// 自定义格式
var(custom_format) = time.formatTime(var(ts), "yyyy/MM/dd HH-mm-ss.SSS");
basic.print(string:"自定义格式: " + var(custom_format));

docs.title: (3) sleep(milliseconds) - 程序暂停
docs.text:
使程序暂停执行指定的毫秒数。

参数： - milliseconds: 整数类型，暂停的毫秒数

返回值：无

示例： 

require("basic");
require("time");

basic.print("开始等待...");

// 暂停2000毫秒（2秒）
time.sleep(int:2000);

basic.print("等待结束！");

docs.title: (4) diffTime(start_time, end_time) - 计算时间差
docs.text:
计算两个时间戳之间的差值（毫秒）。

参数： - start_time: 整数类型，开始时间戳 - end_time: 整数类型，结束时间戳

返回值：整数类型，时间差（毫秒）

示例： 

require("basic");
require("time");

// 记录开始时间
var(start) = time.timestamp();

// 执行一些操作
var(sum) = int:0;
for(var(i) = int:0; i < int:1000000; i = i + int:1) {
    sum = sum + i;
}

// 记录结束时间
var(end) = time.timestamp();

// 计算执行时间
var(duration) = time.diffTime(var(start), var(end));
basic.print(string:"操作执行时间: " + string:var(duration) + " 毫秒");

docs.title: (5) getDateTime() - 获取当前日期时间
docs.text:
获取当前系统的日期和时间字符串。

参数：无 返回值：字符串类型，当前日期和时间（格式：yyyy-MM-dd HHss）

示例： 

require("basic");
require("time");

// 获取当前日期时间
var(now) = time.getDateTime();
basic.print(string:"当前时间: " + var(now));

docs.title: 4.1 倒计时器
docs.text:
require("basic");
require("time");

// 倒计时秒数
var(countdown) = int:10;

basic.print(string:"倒计时 " + string:var(countdown) + " 秒开始...");

// 倒计时循环
while(var(countdown) > int:0) {
    basic.print(string:"剩余时间: " + string:var(countdown) + " 秒");
    time.sleep(int:1000);  // 暂停1秒
    countdown = countdown - int:1;
}

basic.print("倒计时结束！");

docs.title: 4.2 性能计时器
docs.text:
require("basic");
require("time");

// 测试不同操作的性能
basic.print("性能测试开始...");

// 测试字符串拼接
var(str_start) = time.timestamp();
var(long_str) = string:"";
for(var(i) = int:0; i < int:10000; i = i + int:1) {
    long_str = long_str + string:"a";
}
var(str_end) = time.timestamp();
var(str_time) = time.diffTime(var(str_start), var(str_end));
basic.print(string:"字符串拼接10000次耗时: " + string:var(str_time) + " 毫秒");

// 测试数学运算
var(math_start) = time.timestamp();
var(result) = int:0;
for(var(i) = int:0; i < int:10000000; i = i + int:1) {
    result = (result + i) % int:100;
}
var(math_end) = time.timestamp();
var(math_time) = time.diffTime(var(math_start), var(math_end));
basic.print(string:"数学运算1000万次耗时: " + string:var(math_time) + " 毫秒");

docs.title: 5. 注意事项
docs.text:
1. 时间戳是基于系统时间的，用户修改系统时间会影响时间戳的准确性。
  2. sleep() 函数会阻塞程序执行，在执行过程中程序将暂停响应。
  3. 格式化时间的字符串格式不区分大小写，但建议使用大写格式以提高可读性。
  4. 时间戳的精度为毫秒级，适用于大多数应用场景。

docs.title: 1. 菜单系统
docs.text:
require("basic");
basic.print("1. 选项一");
basic.print("2. 选项二");
basic.print("3. 退出");
var(choice) = basic.input("请选择: ");
if(choice == "1") {
    basic.print("你选择了选项一");
} else if(choice == "2") {
    basic.print("你选择了选项二");
} else {
    basic.print("退出程序");
}

docs.title: Welcome to LeonBasic Programming Language
docs.text:
LeonBasic is a simple and easy-to-use interpreted programming language designed for beginners and rapid prototyping. It provides clear and concise syntax while supporting basic programming features such as variables, functions, control flow, file operations, and network capabilities.

Here's its operational diagram:

graph LR
    %% External participants
    Dev["Developer"]:::external

    subgraph "Core Engine"
        direction TB
        CLI["LeonBasic Command Line Tool"]:::core
        Parser["Parser & Abstract Syntax Tree"]:::core
        Evaluator["Executor / Runtime"]:::core
        Builtins["Built-in Libraries"]:::core
        PackageLoader["Package/Module Loader"]:::core
    end

    TestRunner["Testing Tools"]:::test

    subgraph "Tools & Integration"
        direction TB
        VSExt["VS Code Extension"]:::tooling
        Docs["Documentation Generator"]:::tooling
        Trae["Trae Engine"]:::tooling
    end

    %% Flow (improved arrow text with spaces + logical description)
    Dev -->|"Write .leon code"| CLI
    CLI -->|"Parse and build AST"| Parser

    TestRunner -->|"Run .leon code via CLI"| CLI

    Dev -->|"Edit and preview"| VSExt

docs.title: Main Features
docs.text:
• Concise syntax - Easy to learn and use
  • Built-in libraries - Including basic operations and network capabilities
  • Flexible variable system - Supports strings, integers, and floating-point numbers
  • Comprehensive control flow - Including conditional statements and loops
  • File operations - Supports reading, writing, and appending to files
  • Network functionality - Supports HTTP requests and file downloads
  • Error handling - Provides exception catching mechanisms

docs.title: Quick Start
docs.text:
1. Check out the Getting Started guide
  2. Learn the Basic Syntax
  3. Explore advanced features like Control Flow, File Operations, and more

docs.title: 1. Printing "Hello world!"
docs.text:
First, import the basic library: 

require("basic");
Then call the print function: 
basic.print(string:"Hello world!");
* Format: basic.print(string: "content"); * Parameter: string type, the content to be printed

docs.title: (1) Using variables to output "hi!"
docs.text:
require("basic");
var(a) = string:"hi!";
basic.print(var(a));

docs.title: (2) Combining string and int into variable c and printing
docs.text:
require("basic");
var(a) = string:"Number: ";
var(b) = int:2;
var(c) = var(a) + string:var(b);
basic.print(var(c));
* Output result: Number: 2

docs.title: (3) Variable Types
docs.text: Supported types include: * string: string * int: integer * float: floating-point number

docs.title: 3. Escape Characters
docs.text: In strings, you can use escape characters to represent special characters:

docs.title: (1) Supported Escape Characters
docs.text:
• \n: newline character
  • \t: tab character
  • \r: carriage return
  • \": double quote
  • \\: backslash
  • \+: plus sign (special escape, displays as +)

docs.title: (2) Escape Character Examples
docs.text:
require("basic");

// Basic escape characters
basic.print(string:"First line\nSecond line");

// Escape double quotes
basic.print(string:"He said: \"Hello!\"");

// \+ escapes to +
basic.print(string:"5 \+ 3 = 8");

// Backslash escape
basic.print(string:"Path: C:\\\\folder\\\\file.txt");

docs.title: (3) Using Escape Characters in String Concatenation
docs.text:
require("basic");
var(a) = string:"Hello ";
var(b) = string:"\+ World!";
basic.print(var(a) + var(b));  // Output: Hello + World!

docs.title: (1) Functions Without Parameters
docs.text:
require("basic");
func(test()) = {
    basic.print("Hello world!");
};
test();  // Call function, outputs Hello world!

docs.title: (2) Functions With Parameters
docs.text:
require("basic");
func(add(self(first), self(second))) = {
    basic.print(int:self(first) + int:self(second));
};
add(int:1, int:2);  // Call function, outputs 3

docs.title: (3) Parameter Access Syntax
docs.text: In function bodies, use self(param_name) to access parameter values: * int:self(first) - Get the integer value of parameter first * string:self(second) - Get the string value of parameter second * float:self(param) - Get the floating-point value of parameter param

docs.title: (1) basic library
docs.text:
• print(): Print text or other content
  • runoscommand(): Run system commands
  • setrequirepath(): Set the location of require libraries (doesn't affect built-in libraries)
  • input(): Request user input
  • pause(): Let the user press any key to continue

docs.title: (2) request library
docs.text:
• get(): Fetch content
  • download(): Download files
  • check(): View status code
  • header(): View header information
  • footer(): View footer information

docs.title: (3) time library
docs.text:
• timestamp(): Get current timestamp (milliseconds)
  • formatTime(): Format timestamp to string
  • sleep(): Pause program for specified milliseconds
  • diffTime(): Calculate difference between two timestamps (milliseconds)
  • getDateTime(): Get current date and time string

docs.title: 1. Conditional Statements (if-else)
docs.text:
require("basic");
var(a) = int:5;
if(a > 3) {
    basic.print("a is greater than 3");
} else {
    basic.print("a is not greater than 3");
}

docs.title: 2. Loops (for/while)
docs.text:
require("basic");

// for loop
for(var(i) = int:0; i < 5; i = i + 1) {
    basic.print(string:"Loop count: " + string:i);
}

// while loop
var(j) = int:0;
while(j < 3) {
    basic.print(string:"While loop: " + string:j);
    j = j + 1;
}

docs.title: 3. Nested Conditional Statements
docs.text:
require("basic");
var(score) = int:85;

if(score >= 90) {
    basic.print("Excellent!");
} else if(score >= 80) {
    basic.print("Good!");
} else if(score >= 60) {
    basic.print("Pass.");
} else {
    basic.print("Fail.");
}

docs.title: 4. Nested Loops
docs.text:
require("basic");

// Nested for loops
for(var(row) = int:1; row <= 3; row = row + 1) {
    for(var(col) = int:1; col <= 3; col = col + 1) {
        basic.print(string:"Row " + string:row + ", Column " + string:col);
    }
}

docs.title: 5. Comparison Operators
docs.text:
LeonBasic supports the following comparison operators in conditional statements:

  • >: Greater than
  • <: Less than
  • >=: Greater than or equal to
  • <=: Less than or equal to
  • ==: Equal to
  • !=: Not equal to
require("basic");
var(x) = int:10;
var(y) = int:5;

if(x > y) {
    basic.print("x is greater than y");
}

if(x != y) {
    basic.print("x is not equal to y");
}

docs.title: Error Handling
docs.text: LeonBasic provides error handling capabilities using the try-catch mechanism, allowing you to gracefully handle exceptions that may occur during program execution.

docs.title: 1. try-catch Exception Handling
docs.text:
require("basic");
try {
    var(a) = int:5 / int:0;
} catch(error) {
    basic.print(string:"Error occurred: " + error);
}

docs.title: 2. Common Error Types
docs.text:
Here are some common errors you might encounter in LeonBasic:

  • Division by zero errors
  • File not found errors
  • Type mismatch errors
  • Network connection errors
  • Module loading errors

docs.title: 3. Handling File Operation Errors
docs.text:
require("basic");
try {
    var(file) = basic.open("nonexistent_file.txt", "read");
    var(content) = basic.read(file);
    basic.close(file);
} catch(error) {
    basic.print(string:"File operation error: " + error);
}

docs.title: 4. Handling Network Errors
docs.text:
require("basic");
require("request");
try {
    var(response) = request.get("https://unreachable-site.com");
    basic.print(response);
} catch(error) {
    basic.print(string:"Network error: " + error);
}

docs.title: 5. Handling Type Errors
docs.text:
require("basic");
try {
    // Attempting to concatenate incompatible types
    var(result) = string:"Hello" + int:123;
    basic.print(var(result));
} catch(error) {
    basic.print(string:"Type error: " + error);
}

docs.title: 6. Nested try-catch Blocks
docs.text:
You can nest try-catch blocks to handle errors at different levels:

require("basic");
try {
    // Outer try block
    var(file) = basic.open("data.txt", "read");
    try {
        // Inner try block
        var(content) = basic.read(file);
        var(invalid_operation) = int:10 / int:0;
    } catch(inner_error) {
        basic.print(string:"Error processing file content: " + inner_error);
    }
    basic.close(file);
} catch(outer_error) {
    basic.print(string:"Error opening or closing file: " + outer_error);
}

docs.title: 7. Best Practices for Error Handling
docs.text:
• Always wrap operations that might fail (file operations, network requests, divisions) in try-catch blocks
  • Provide meaningful error messages to help with debugging
  • Ensure resources are properly released even when errors occur (e.g., close files)
  • Consider implementing error recovery strategies where appropriate
  • Log errors for troubleshooting purposes

docs.title: File Operations
docs.text: LeonBasic provides functions for basic file operations, including reading, writing, and appending to files.

docs.title: 1. File Writing
docs.text:
require("basic");
var(file) = basic.open("test.txt", "write");
basic.write(file, "Hello, world!");
basic.close(file);

docs.title: 2. File Reading
docs.text:
require("basic");
var(file) = basic.open("test.txt", "read");
var(content) = basic.read(file);
basic.print(content);
basic.close(file);

docs.title: 3. File Appending
docs.text:
require("basic");
var(file) = basic.open("test.txt", "append");
basic.write(file, " Append content");
basic.close(file);

docs.title: 4. File Open Modes
docs.text:
LeonBasic supports the following file open modes:

  • "read" - Open file for reading
  • "write" - Open file for writing (overwrites existing content)
  • "append" - Open file for appending (adds to existing content)

docs.title: 5. Error Handling in File Operations
docs.text:
It's good practice to handle potential errors when working with files:

require("basic");
try {
    var(file) = basic.open("nonexistent.txt", "read");
    var(content) = basic.read(file);
    basic.print(content);
    basic.close(file);
} catch(error) {
    basic.print(string:"Error: " + error);
}

docs.title: 6. Working with File Paths
docs.text:
require("basic");

// Using absolute path
var(file) = basic.open("C:\\Projects\\test.txt", "write");
basic.write(file, "Content with absolute path");
basic.close(file);

// Using relative path
var(file2) = basic.open(".\\data\\info.txt", "write");
basic.write(file2, "Content with relative path");
basic.close(file2);

docs.title: 7. Reading Line by Line
docs.text:
While LeonBasic doesn't have a built-in function for reading line by line, you can split the content by newline characters:

require("basic");

// This is a simplified example that assumes the file exists
var(file) = basic.open("test.txt", "read");
var(content) = basic.read(file);
basic.close(file);

// Note: This is just conceptual - actual implementation would require string splitting functionality
// which may need to be implemented based on LeonBasic's capabilities

docs.title: Installation
docs.text: LeonBasic is a Rust-based interpreted language. Follow these steps to install and run it:

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
• Rust programming language (latest stable version recommended)
  • Cargo package manager (included with Rust)

docs.title: Clone the Repository
docs.text:
git clone https://github.com/leonmmcoset/leonlang.git
cd leonlang

docs.title: Build the Project
docs.text: cargo build

docs.title: Run a LeonBasic Program
docs.text: cargo run path/to/your/file.leon

docs.title: Your First LeonBasic Program
docs.text:
Create a file named hello.leon with the following content:

require("basic");
basic.print(string:"Hello, World!");

Run it with:

cargo run hello.leon

You should see the output: Hello, World!

docs.title: Basic Workflow
docs.text:
1. Write your code in a .leon file
  2. Run the code using the LeonBasic interpreter
  3. Debug as needed

docs.title: VS Code Extension
docs.text:
LeonBasic provides a VS Code extension for better development experience. You can find it in the addons directory of the repository.

To install the extension:

  1. Open VS Code
  2. Go to Extensions
  3. Click on the three dots in the top right corner
  4. Select "Install from VSIX..."
  5. Choose the .vsix file from the addons directory

docs.title: 1. require Function
docs.text: LeonBasic provides the require() function for importing built-in libraries and custom modules, enabling code modularity and reuse.

docs.title: (1) Importing Built-in Libraries
docs.text:
// Import basic library
require("basic");

// Import network request library
require("request");

// Import time processing library
require("time");

docs.title: (2) Importing Custom Modules
docs.text:
// Import utils.leon module from the current directory
require("utils");

// Use functions from the module
var(result) = utils.add(int:5, int:3);
basic.print(string:"5 + 3 = " + string:var(result));

docs.title: 2. Module Search Path
docs.text:
When using require(module_name), the system will search for modules in the following order:

  1. First, look for built-in libraries (such as basic, request)
  2. Then look for module_name.leon file in the current script's directory
  3. If not found, it will look in the lib subdirectory of the current directory

docs.title: (1) Creating a Simple Module
docs.text:
Create a file named utils.leon:

// utils.leon

// Define module functions
func(add(a, b)) = {
    return a + b;
};

func(multiply(a, b)) = {
    return a * b;
};

func(greet(name)) = {
    return "Hello, " + name + "!";
};

docs.title: (2) Module Usage Example
docs.text:
// main.leon
require("basic");
require("utils");

// Use functions from the utils module
var(sum) = utils.add(int:5, int:3);
basic.print(string:"5 + 3 = " + string:var(sum));

var(product) = utils.multiply(int:7, int:4);
basic.print(string:"7 * 4 = " + string:var(product));

var(greeting) = utils.greet(string:"World");
basic.print(var(greeting));

docs.title: 4. Setting require Path
docs.text:
You can use the basic.setrequirepath() function to customize the module search path:

require("basic");

// Set custom module path
basic.setrequirepath("C:\\Projects\\LeonBasic\\modules");

// Now you can load modules from the custom path
require("custom_module");

docs.title: 5. Module Function Call Syntax
docs.text:
When using imported module functions, follow this syntax:

// module_name.function_name(param1, param2, ...)
module_name.function_name(param1, param2, ...);

docs.title: 6. Module Loading Notes
docs.text:
• Module files must have the .leon extension
  • A module can be imported multiple times but will only be executed once
  • Variables and functions in a module are visible to the importer
  • Modules can import each other, but avoid circular dependencies

docs.title: Network
docs.text: LeonBasic provides network capabilities through the request library, allowing you to make HTTP requests and download files.

docs.title: 1. HTTP GET Request
docs.text:
require("basic");
require("request");

var(response) = request.get("https://example.com");
basic.print(response);

docs.title: 2. Downloading Files
docs.text:
require("basic");
require("request");

// Download a file from a URL to a local path
request.download("https://example.com/image.jpg", "local.jpg");
basic.print("File downloaded successfully!");

docs.title: 3. Checking HTTP Status Codes
docs.text:
require("basic");
require("request");

var(status) = request.check("https://example.com");
basic.print(string:"HTTP Status Code: " + status);

docs.title: 4. Getting HTTP Headers
docs.text:
require("basic");
require("request");

var(headers) = request.header("https://example.com");
basic.print(headers);

docs.title: 5. Getting HTTP Footer Information
docs.text:
require("basic");
require("request");

var(footer) = request.footer("https://example.com");
basic.print(footer);

docs.title: 6. Error Handling in Network Operations
docs.text:
It's important to handle errors that may occur during network operations:

require("basic");
require("request");

try {
    var(response) = request.get("https://nonexistentwebsite123456789.com");
    basic.print(response);
} catch(error) {
    basic.print(string:"Network error: " + error);
}

docs.title: 7. Working with API Responses
docs.text:
require("basic");
require("request");

// Fetch data from an API
try {
    var(api_response) = request.get("https://api.example.com/data");
    basic.print(string:"API Response: " + api_response);
} catch(error) {
    basic.print(string:"Failed to fetch API data: " + error);
}

docs.title: 1. Introduction
docs.text: LeonBasic provides the time built-in library for handling time-related operations, including getting timestamps, formatting time, program pausing, and more.

docs.title: 2. Import Method
docs.text:
Before using the time library, you need to import it:

require("time");

docs.title: (1) timestamp() - Get Current Timestamp
docs.text:
Gets the current system time as a millisecond timestamp.

Parameters: None Return Value: Integer type, representing milliseconds since 1970-01-01 00:00:00 UTC

Example: 

require("basic");
require("time");

// Get current timestamp
var(ts) = time.timestamp();
basic.print(string:"Current timestamp: " + string:var(ts));

docs.title: (2) formatTime(timestamp, format) - Format Timestamp
docs.text:
Formats a timestamp into a specified format string.

Parameters: - timestamp: Integer type, the timestamp - format: String type, the format string

Return Value: String type, the formatted time string

Format Specifications: - yyyy: Four-digit year - MM: Two-digit month (01-12) - dd: Two-digit day (01-31) - HH: Two-digit hour (00-23) - mm: Two-digit minute (00-59) - ss: Two-digit second (00-59) - SSS: Three-digit millisecond (000-999)

Example: 

require("basic");
require("time");

// Get current timestamp
var(ts) = time.timestamp();

// Default format (yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss)
var(default_format) = time.formatTime(var(ts), "");
basic.print(string:"Default format: " + var(default_format));

// Custom format
var(custom_format) = time.formatTime(var(ts), "yyyy/MM/dd HH-mm-ss.SSS");
basic.print(string:"Custom format: " + var(custom_format));

docs.title: (3) sleep(milliseconds) - Pause Program
docs.text:
Pauses program execution for the specified number of milliseconds.

Parameters: - milliseconds: Integer type, the number of milliseconds to pause

Return Value: None

Example: 

require("basic");
require("time");

basic.print("Waiting...");

// Pause for 2000 milliseconds (2 seconds)
time.sleep(int:2000);

basic.print("Wait completed!");

docs.title: (4) diffTime(start_time, end_time) - Calculate Time Difference
docs.text:
Calculates the difference between two timestamps (in milliseconds).

Parameters: - start_time: Integer type, the start timestamp - end_time: Integer type, the end timestamp

Return Value: Integer type, the time difference (in milliseconds)

Example: 

require("basic");
require("time");

// Record start time
var(start) = time.timestamp();

// Perform some operations
var(sum) = int:0;
for(var(i) = int:0; i < int:1000000; i = i + int:1) {
    sum = sum + i;
}

// Record end time
var(end) = time.timestamp();

// Calculate execution time
var(duration) = time.diffTime(var(start), var(end));
basic.print(string:"Operation execution time: " + string:var(duration) + " milliseconds");

docs.title: (5) getDateTime() - Get Current Date and Time
docs.text:
Gets the current system date and time as a string.

Parameters: None Return Value: String type, current date and time (format: yyyy-MM-dd HHss)

Example: 

require("basic");
require("time");

// Get current date and time
var(now) = time.getDateTime();
basic.print(string:"Current time: " + var(now));

docs.title: 4.1 Countdown Timer
docs.text:
require("basic");
require("time");

// Countdown seconds
var(countdown) = int:10;

basic.print(string:"Countdown " + string:var(countdown) + " seconds started...");

// Countdown loop
while(var(countdown) > int:0) {
    basic.print(string:"Remaining time: " + string:var(countdown) + " seconds");
    time.sleep(int:1000);  // Pause for 1 second
    countdown = countdown - int:1;
}

basic.print("Countdown finished!");

docs.title: 4.2 Performance Timer
docs.text:
require("basic");
require("time");

// Test performance of different operations
basic.print("Performance test started...");

// Test string concatenation
var(str_start) = time.timestamp();
var(long_str) = string:"";
for(var(i) = int:0; i < int:10000; i = i + int:1) {
    long_str = long_str + string:"a";
}
var(str_end) = time.timestamp();
var(str_time) = time.diffTime(var(str_start), var(str_end));
basic.print(string:"String concatenation 10000 times took: " + string:var(str_time) + " milliseconds");

// Test mathematical operations
var(math_start) = time.timestamp();
var(result) = int:0;
for(var(i) = int:0; i < int:10000000; i = i + int:1) {
    result = (result + i) % int:100;
}
var(math_end) = time.timestamp();
var(math_time) = time.diffTime(var(math_start), var(math_end));
basic.print(string:"Mathematical operations 10 million times took: " + string:var(math_time) + " milliseconds");

docs.title: 5. Notes
docs.text:
1. Timestamps are based on system time, and modifying the system time will affect the accuracy of timestamps.
  2. The sleep() function blocks program execution, and the program will be unresponsive during execution.
  3. The format string for time formatting is case-insensitive, but uppercase format is recommended for readability.
  4. The timestamp precision is millisecond level, suitable for most application scenarios.

docs.title: User Interaction
docs.text: LeonBasic provides functions for interacting with users, including requesting input and creating simple menu systems.

docs.title: 1. Menu System
docs.text:
require("basic");
basic.print("1. Option One");
basic.print("2. Option Two");
basic.print("3. Exit");
var(choice) = basic.input("Please select: ");
if(choice == "1") {
    basic.print("You selected Option One");
} else if(choice == "2") {
    basic.print("You selected Option Two");
} else {
    basic.print("Exiting program");
}

docs.title: 2. Getting User Input
docs.text:
Use the basic.input() function to request input from the user:

require("basic");
var(name) = basic.input("What is your name? ");
basic.print(string:"Hello, " + var(name) + string:"!");

docs.title: 3. Input Validation
docs.text:
require("basic");
var(age_input) = basic.input("Please enter your age: ");
try {
    var(age) = int:var(age_input);
    if(age > 0) {
        basic.print(string:"You are " + string:age + string:" years old");
    } else {
        basic.print("Invalid age entered");
    }
} catch(error) {
    basic.print("Please enter a valid number");
}

docs.title: 4. Multi-step User Interaction
docs.text:
require("basic");
basic.print("--- User Information Form ---");

var(first_name) = basic.input("First Name: ");
var(last_name) = basic.input("Last Name: ");
var(email) = basic.input("Email: ");

basic.print("");
basic.print("Your information:");
basic.print(string:"Name: " + var(first_name) + string:" " + var(last_name));
basic.print(string:"Email: " + var(email));

docs.title: 5. Confirmation Dialog
docs.text:
require("basic");
var(confirm) = basic.input("Are you sure you want to continue? (y/n): ");
if(confirm == "y" || confirm == "Y") {
    basic.print("Continuing with the operation...");
} else {
    basic.print("Operation cancelled");
}

docs.title: 6. Using pause() for User Experience
docs.text:
The pause() function can be used to create better user experience by waiting for user confirmation before proceeding:

require("basic");
basic.print("Important information displayed here");
basic.print("Press any key to continue...");
basic.pause();
basic.print("Continuing with the program");

docs.title: 7. Interactive Calculator Example
docs.text:
require("basic");
basic.print("--- Simple Calculator ---");
var(num1_input) = basic.input("Enter first number: ");
var(num2_input) = basic.input("Enter second number: ");
var(operation) = basic.input("Select operation (+, -, *, /): ");

try {
    var(num1) = int:var(num1_input);
    var(num2) = int:var(num2_input);

    if(operation == "+ ") {
        basic.print(string:"Result: " + string:(num1 + num2));
    } else if(operation == "- ") {
        basic.print(string:"Result: " + string:(num1 - num2));
    } else if(operation == "* ") {
        basic.print(string:"Result: " + string:(num1 * num2));
    } else if(operation == "/ ") {
        basic.print(string:"Result: " + string:(num1 / num2));
    } else {
        basic.print("Invalid operation");
    }
} catch(error) {
    basic.print(string:"Error: " + error);
}
